summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing charges for shipping services. The invoice includes information about customs duties and taxes related to shipments sent from New York to Paris. It highlights the financial transactions associated with Epstein's FedEx account.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the primary individual associated with the FedEx account referenced in the invoice, indicating his involvement in shipping activities.

persons.name: Valdson Cotrin
persons.context: Valdson Cotrin is mentioned as a recipient of shipments sent by Jeffrey E. Epstein, indicating a business or personal relationship.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein is sending shipments to Valdson Cotrin, suggesting a business relationship.

events.title: Shipment Date
events.description: Two shipments were sent by Jeffrey E. Epstein on this date, as indicated in the invoice.

events.title: Invoice Issued
events.description: The invoice detailing shipping charges and customs duties was issued on this date.

keyFacts: The invoice is dated July 24, 2002, and pertains to shipping charges incurred by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Total charges on the invoice amount to $283.52.
Two shipments were sent on July 19, 2002, with details provided for customs duties and taxes.
Valdson Cotrin is identified as a recipient of shipments from Epstein, indicating a connection between them.
The document includes references to customs duties paid to French authorities on behalf of Epstein.
